Headline: Russia and Uzbekistan launch military drills near Afghan border
News Content: A joint Russian-Uzbek exercise started at the Termez mountain range in the Surkhandarya region of the Republic of Uzbekistan on Monday (August 2). The joint drill near the Afghan border was launched amid fears in both countries that a worsening security situation in Afghanistan could spill over into Central Asia. Russia said 1,500 Russian and Uzbek troops would take part in the five-day exercises.
